phrases.usage: Use this simple greeting to tell people your name when you first meet.
phrases.example: Hello, I'm Maya and I am a very friendly student.

phrases.usage: Say this politely after someone tells you their name for the first time.
phrases.example: It is nice to meet you in this busy class.

phrases.usage: Use this to explain your current activity or goal in the language school.
phrases.example: I am studying English to get a very good job.

phrases.usage: Explain your specific motivation for taking this class to your new classmates.
phrases.example: I want to speak better to have easy daily conversations.

phrases.usage: A short way to explain that English is necessary for your professional life.
phrases.example: I need to learn English for my new exciting job.

phrases.usage: Tell others about your previous experience with the language in a different setting.
phrases.example: I learned English at school as a very young student.

phrases.usage: Express your positive feelings about the current learning environment or the lessons.
phrases.example: I like this class because the other students are kind.

phrases.usage: A polite way to show appreciation to your instructor at the end.
phrases.example: Thank you, teacher, for helping me learn these difficult words.

keyVocabulary.definition: Kind and pleasant towards other people in the room.
Willing to help other students with their classroom work.
Feeling a little worried about speaking in a new language.
Feeling very happy and enthusiastic about starting a new course.
A room or space with a lot of natural light.
